About

I'm Caleb Lanphere, a Computer Science major at St. Bonaventure University. I spend my time working on various programming projects.

I have worked in various programming languages, such as C++, Java, PHP, JavaScript, and scripting languages such as HTML and CSS.

I use Unreal Engine to produce various experiences, which I have done since 2022, all of their programming getting better as I learned.

Around the Web

Copyright © 2024 Caleb Lanphere, Faz Creativity, Creativity Studios | All rights reserved

Breakout

A security design game that has you creating a security system for various locations across the city, from simple shops to government facilities. Can you manage to balance out budget and effectiveness to gain more business and reach the tops of the security design world?

Project is currently in development - Demo Release Date: TBD

Red Cell: Point Zero

A tactical FPS games that packs in intense battles between you and swarms of highly trained agents as you try to steal your life back from the government who labeled you as a terrorist after a botched mission.

Project is currently in development

13 Days To The End

A 3D animation created for American History of War through Film in 2022. It details an alternative timeline where the United States and Russia fell into a nuclear war and shows the moments before the missiles were launched.

Released onto YouTube on December 8th, 2022.

Revolt

A third-person shooter experience akin to GTA style games, has you follow a man who lost everything he valued and had to use his skills gained as a SWAT member to survive the cruel world who left our hero behind.

Project is currently in development

Operation Hacksaw

A project made for a high school American History course that revolved around the ending scene from the movie Hacksaw Ridge. The game is low quality and is not a full showcase of my knowledge.

Released January 13th, 2023

ConstructHome

A project made for a high school math course, without guidelines or end goal. The project is low quality and not a full showcase of my knowledge.

Released May 23rd, 2022

TextMe

A project made in the fall of 2024 during my first year. The program was created in the Java programming language. The program uses Peer-To-Peer technology for connection and TCP technology to transmit over the internet. Further technical information is available on GitHub

View on Github
